metadata.feature_description: Manages assets across multiple portals with portal-specific root folders and permissions

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and observe portal selection screen
steps.expected: Portal selection screen should display available portals
steps.actual: Portal selection screen displayed with three options: Global Assets, My Website, and Test Portal 2

steps.expected: Portal-specific assets for My Website should be displayed
steps.actual: My Website assets loaded successfully showing folders (Badges, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder, Templates, TestFolder01, ToBeDeleted, Users) and files

steps.action: Navigate back to portal selection and click on 'Global Assets'
steps.expected: Host-level assets should be displayed with globe icons
steps.actual: Global Assets loaded successfully showing host-level folders (Cache, Config, Containers, EventQueue, Images, Install, Logs, Skins, Smileys, Templates, Users) and system files with globe icons indicating host-level assets

steps.action: Navigate back to portal selection and click on 'Test Portal 2'
steps.expected: Assets for Test Portal 2 should be displayed, different from My Website
steps.actual: Test Portal 2 assets loaded successfully showing a different, smaller set of assets (Badges, Templates, Users folders and GettingStarted.css, logo.png files) compared to My Website

steps.action: Navigate into Templates folder in Test Portal 2
steps.expected: Portal-specific Templates folder content should be displayed
steps.actual: Templates folder for Test Portal 2 shows only Default.page.template file

steps.action: Switch to My Website portal and navigate to Templates folder
steps.expected: My Website Templates folder should show its own content
steps.actual: My Website Templates folder also shows Default.page.template, but root folder structure is different with additional folders like FolderToMove, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder

steps.action: View My Website root folder structure
steps.expected: Root folder should show portal-specific folders
steps.actual: My Website root shows: Badges, FolderToMove, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder (secure folder with lock icon), Templates, Users - different structure than Test Portal 2

steps.action: Create a new folder 'TestPortal2Folder' in Test Portal 2
steps.expected: Folder should be created successfully in Test Portal 2
steps.actual: Add Folder dialog appeared with Name field and Type dropdown. Folder 'TestPortal2Folder' was entered

steps.expected: Folder should appear in Test Portal 2 assets list
steps.actual: Folder 'TestPortal2Folder' successfully created and visible in Test Portal 2 assets list between Templates and Users

steps.action: Switch to My Website portal and verify TestPortal2Folder does not appear
steps.expected: TestPortal2Folder should NOT be visible in My Website - confirming portal isolation
steps.actual: My Website assets displayed without TestPortal2Folder - portal isolation confirmed. Only My Website-specific folders visible: Badges, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder, Templates, Users

steps.action: Switch to Global Assets and verify TestPortal2Folder does not appear
steps.expected: TestPortal2Folder should NOT be visible in Global Assets - confirming portal isolation from host level
steps.actual: Global Assets displayed without TestPortal2Folder - portal isolation from host level confirmed. Only host-level folders visible: Cache, Config, Containers, EventQueue, Images, Install, Logs, Skins

steps.action: As SuperUser, access and manage assets across all portals
steps.expected: SuperUser should have access to all portals and be able to create/manage assets
steps.actual: SuperUser successfully accessed Global Assets, My Website, and Test Portal 2. Created folder 'TestPortal2Folder' in Test Portal 2, demonstrating cross-portal management capabilities

steps.action: Verify Add Folder and Add Asset buttons are available in each portal
steps.expected: Management controls should be available for authorized user
steps.actual: Add Folder and Add Asset buttons visible and functional in all portals (Global Assets, My Website, Test Portal 2)

observations: The portal selection interface provides clear visual distinction between Global Assets (globe icon) and portal-specific assets (folder icon)
Portal isolation is properly enforced - assets created in one portal are not visible in other portals
Host-level Global Assets contain system folders like Cache, Config, Containers, EventQueue, Install, Logs, Skins, etc.
Portal-specific assets contain user content folders like Badges, Groups, Images, Templates, Users
SuperUser (host) has full access to all portals and can manage assets across them
Breadcrumb navigation clearly shows current location (HOME > folder path)
Sorting and search functionality available within each portal context
